OPINION
{¶ 1} Appellant Amber N. Truax appeals her conviction on one count of possession of drug paraphernalia and one count of possession of marijuana. opinions.snippet:
MEMORANDUM OF DECISION
Frank J. Bailey, United States Bankruptcy Judge
By their complaint in this adversary proceeding, the three plaintiffs, all siblings of the chapter 7 debtor, seek a determination that the claims they assert against him are excepted from discharge under 11 U.S.C. § 523(a)(2)(A), (a)(4), and (a)(6). Their underlying claims, which remain unadjudicated, are for breaches of the defendant’

caseName: Siloam Springs Hotel, L.L.C. v. Century Surety Co.
caseNameFull: SILOAM SPRINGS HOTEL, L.L.C., Plaintiff-Appellant, v. CENTURY SURETY COMPANY, Defendant-Appellee
court: Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit

opinions.snippet:
MURPHY, Circuit Judge.
 

  I. INTRODUCTION
 

  This case requires that we decide how to determine the citizenship, for purposes of diversity jurisdiction, of a limited liability company (“LLC”). Like every other circuit to consider this question, this court concludes an LLC, as an unincorporated association, takes the citizenship of all its members.
